item.title: Another holiday season in the books
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded: We celebrated Graeme’s 1st and Maggie’s 4th Christmas with no shortage of candy canes, caroling, and cheer! Maggie was really into Christmas this year and it made everything all the more exciting – from writing her list, to shopping for her brother and daddy, to posing for the holiday card photo, she did it all with a smile on her face and a skip in her step.  We got to meet Santa, see the Nutcracker her dance school put on, decorate gingerbread houses, and see lots of family and friends – while it’s always sad when the holidays are over, ours were so jam-packed that I’m looking forward to a quiet January!

item.title: Halloween 2016
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded: We found lots of opportunities to dress up this Halloween season – Boo at the Stone Zoo with the Fourniers, Trunk or Treat at St. Col’s with cousins, and Trick or Treating with the Morgans.

item.title: Happy Holidays
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
We had a wonderful holiday season – Maggie really started to understand what was going on this year and was so excited.  We embraced every opportunity to celebrate the holidays including a night to Edaville Railroad, a toddler-friendly showing of the Nutcracker by the Metrowest Ballet and of course, lots of visits with friends and family!

The lead up….

  

Christmas!

and New Years!

item.title: Two.
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
Two. Years. How has it been two years??

What feels equally like a lifetime and a blink of an eye – Maggie turned two this month.  She has become quite the character over in the past year, and definitely in the last few months.  A chatty girl who loves all things purple, has a new obsession with dinosaurs, and has more “buddies” at school than we can name – she is growing into a little girl and is definitely no longer a baby.

A quick look at Maggie today:

Favorite songs: Baa Baa Black Sheep, Let It Go, ABCs
Loves to recite “5 Little Monkeys”
Stands at 34 inches and weighs 26 lbs – right in the middle of curve for her age on both.
Talking in short sentences – including “I do it myself” and “I like this ____ ”
Must have for sleep – Giraffe and Owl lovies (one of each) – thankfully we have 2 of each so they get washed biweekly!
Favorite new activity: letting mommy paint her toenails, purple of course.

We celebrated her birthday with the Harringtons/Healeys over the July 4th weekend, saw all of mommy’s side the day prior to her birthday at Aoife’s 1st birthday party, and had a special visit with the Blaisdell twins on her actual birthday.  3 different events with lots of cake, presents, and all our favorite people made for a great 2nd celebration!

item.title: Tis the Season
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
This Christmas season was definitely one of the most fun ones we’ve had in a while – Maggie began to get excited by Santa, reindeer, snowmen…everything holiday related.  She had a pair of reindeer antlers that were worn daily from December 1st onwards!

Pre-Christmas we enjoyed the first snowfall of the year (little did we know it would be a while before we’d see it again!), went to Edaville Railroad, visited Stone Zoo for their Zoo Lights and to see Santa, baked cookies, and enjoyed lots of cousin time.

               

And finally, after nightly readings of the Night Before Christmas, it finally was, the night before Christmas….

and then the big day!

 

We all had a lovely Christmas – Maggie was really into ripping the wrapping paper and received so many lovely gifts, she’s still making her way though all the new toys!  As always, I’m sad to say goodbye to the Christmas decorations and extra family time, but on to 2015 we go!

item.title: Fall Fun
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
Fall has always been my favorite season – give me anything and everything you can with apples, pumpkin, or cinnamon and I’m happy!  As with past years, we took full advantage of the weather and lots of seasonal activities…

…we picked apples.

….and played with pumpkins.

   

…and had playdates with lots of friends.

….and enjoyed a weekend in Maine for Tim and Amanda’s wedding!

 

and had a very Happy Halloween!

Other life updates – I started a new job in September as Sales & Marketing Program Manager at Medullan, it’s been an exciting and busy transition so far, but I’m loving it!  Pat is continually busy with clients and Maggie is growing up so much lately – getting more and more personality and becoming more independent every day.

As the weather gets colder we’ll be sad for the reduction in outdoor activities – thankfully we have the holidays to look forward to!

item.title: Happy Easter!
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
Maggie enjoyed her first Easter – it was filled with stickers, bunny ears, and lots of laughs!


Checking out her basket from Nannie.


Can I eat this chocolate???


Our little bunny!

item.title: A Year in Review
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
This year has been a fantastic one for the Harringtons – here it is by the numbers!

30 years Patrick has been alive

12 months Mildly Geeky has been in full time activity and has already launched 18 websites!

11 different planes boarded and 5 places visited (some multiple times) – Phoenix, DC, San Francisco, Chatham, and Moultonborough

6 foods Maggie will now eat (many of them her Papa Jim won’t even touch!) – Butternut squash, Sweet Potatoes, Apples, Pears, Bananas, Avocado

4 family members added this year (by birth) Aubrey Jordan, Charlotte Fallon, Maggie and (by marriage) Diana Harrington.

3rd anniversary of our wedding celebrated with a baby-free night out

2 weddings attended – congrats to Timmy and Diana Harrington and Steven and Diane Vetree!

 

1 very special hospital stay!

2013 was one for the books – looking forward to what 2014 will bring, Happy New Year!

item.title: Gobble Gobble
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
item.content:encoded:
Just in time for the biggest food holiday of the year – Maggie started on solid foods and she loves it!  So far she’s enjoyed both butternut squash and sweet potatoes with great success – I think we have a foodie in our midst!

 

Hope everyone enjoyed their Thanksgiving dinners as much as she did!

item.title: Happy Halloween
item.dc:creator: Cara Harrington
